author: Hugo Ojeda
title: API for decentralized application
description: The need to have rapid development tools already tested is observed

assessments.note: The proposal is just a draft, there is not enough information to check how it will address the challenge in a relevant way.
Proposal does not detail specifically how to achieve the "effective implementation" cited in the proposal. Cardano has many API proposals active, how does this differ?
There is not enough information to effectively understand goals of this proposal and how it benefits cardano community nor how it aligns with cardano goals. Needs more work - very very basic concept.
incoherent description of problem statement. lack of any further description.
There is no plan and there are not enough details about the proposer's experience / skills

Lacking from the proposal is an effective plan of action and nowhere does it list the language that the API will use if proposal is funded i.e. Rust, JS, or even multiple languages supported by this API. Given the lack of detail and information in this proposal I would say that is it unlikely that this proposal is successfully implemented.

Just an idea at this point. It needs a lot more work. Adding elements of experience to validate the past work, how it fits with present proposal. Some professional presentation, profile links. Also understanding why this budget, what it does - what it can accomplish. Adding that would make this a lot better candidate. At the moment - there is nothing to invest in.
incoherent description of problem statement, fund request how it will be used.

The proposal is not viable due to the lack of information, there is no way to assess how it will address the challenge. I recommend that the proposer follow the Catalyst documentation to prepare the proposal and provide details so that we can give appropriate feedback.

The proposal does not offer much information about how feasible the proposal is, mainly due to the fact it does not state specifically what the clear goals of the API will be, nor what languages will be supported by the API.

Absence of roadmap, milestones, any measurable metrics, challenges, risks. These are just very few elements that would have made this proposal a lot better if they were considered. I suggest to work on it and come back in later funding rounds. Or seeking mentorship within Catalyst advisor group. That could also be a way forward.

solution: in order to shorten development times and achieve effective implementation with APIs developed for that purpose.
